Class Cosmology

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static double
    angularDiameterDistance(double z, double comovingDistance)
    Angular diameter distance. d_A = d_c / (1+z)
    static double
    cmbTemperature(double z)
    Cosmic microwave background temperature at redshift z.
    static double
    comovingDistance(double z, double H0, double omegaM, double omegaLambda)
    Comoving distance (simplified integral for ΛCDM).
    static double
    darkEnergyDensity(double z, double w)
    Dark energy equation of state parameter.
    static double
    decelerationParameter(double omegaM, double omegaLambda)
    Deceleration parameter at present. q0 = Ωm/2 - ΩΛ q0 invalid input: '<' 0 means accelerating expansion
    static double
    friedmannE(double z, double omegaM, double omegaLambda, double omegaR)
    Friedmann equation: H²/H0² = E²(z) E(z) = √(Ωm(1+z)³ + ΩΛ + Ωr(1+z)⁴)
    static double
    hubbleDistance(double z, double H0)
    Hubble distance from redshift (low-z approximation). d = cz / H0
    static double
    hubbleTime(double H0)
    Hubble time (age of universe if expansion were constant). t_H = 1/H0
    static double
    lookbackTime(double z, double H0)
    Lookback time (simplified, matter-dominated). t_lookback ≈ t_H * (1 - (1+z)^(-3/2))
    static double
    luminosityDistance(double z, double comovingDistance)
    Luminosity distance. d_L = (1+z) * d_c
    static double
    recessionVelocity(double distanceMpc, double H0)
    Hubble's law: recession velocity. v = H0 * d
    static double
    redshiftFromScaleFactor(double a)
    Scale factor to redshift. z = 1/a - 1
    static double
    scaleFactor(double z)
    Cosmological redshift to scale factor. a = 1/(1+z)

  • Method Details

    • recessionVelocity

      public static double recessionVelocity(double distanceMpc, double H0)
      Hubble's law: recession velocity. v = H0 * d
      Parameters:
      distanceMpc - Distance in megaparsecs
      H0 - Hubble constant (km/s/Mpc)
      Returns:
      Recession velocity (km/s)

    • hubbleDistance

      public static double hubbleDistance(double z, double H0)
      Hubble distance from redshift (low-z approximation). d = cz / H0

    • hubbleTime

      public static double hubbleTime(double H0)
      Hubble time (age of universe if expansion were constant). t_H = 1/H0
      Parameters:
      H0 - Hubble constant (km/s/Mpc)
      Returns:
      Hubble time in Gyr

    • scaleFactor

      public static double scaleFactor(double z)
      Cosmological redshift to scale factor. a = 1/(1+z)

    • redshiftFromScaleFactor

      public static double redshiftFromScaleFactor(double a)
      Scale factor to redshift. z = 1/a - 1

    • lookbackTime

      public static double lookbackTime(double z, double H0)
      Lookback time (simplified, matter-dominated). t_lookback ≈ t_H * (1 - (1+z)^(-3/2))

    • comovingDistance

      public static double comovingDistance(double z, double H0, double omegaM, double omegaLambda)
      Comoving distance (simplified integral for ΛCDM).

    • luminosityDistance

      public static double luminosityDistance(double z, double comovingDistance)
      Luminosity distance. d_L = (1+z) * d_c

    • angularDiameterDistance

      public static double angularDiameterDistance(double z, double comovingDistance)
      Angular diameter distance. d_A = d_c / (1+z)

    • cmbTemperature

      public static double cmbTemperature(double z)
      Cosmic microwave background temperature at redshift z. T(z) = T0 * (1+z)

    • darkEnergyDensity

      public static double darkEnergyDensity(double z, double w)
      Dark energy equation of state parameter. For cosmological constant: w = -1

    • friedmannE

      public static double friedmannE(double z, double omegaM, double omegaLambda, double omegaR)
      Friedmann equation: H²/H0² = E²(z) E(z) = √(Ωm(1+z)³ + ΩΛ + Ωr(1+z)⁴)

    • decelerationParameter

      public static double decelerationParameter(double omegaM, double omegaLambda)
      Deceleration parameter at present. q0 = Ωm/2 - ΩΛ q0 invalid input: '<' 0 means accelerating expansion
